summary: An FBI intake document recording a tip received on October 9, 2020, regarding a party hosted by Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach, Florida, around Christmas 2000. The caller describes being introduced to individuals associated with modeling and procurement, and mentions an invitation to a party at Mar-a-Lago.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of investigation, alleged party host
persons.context: The document is an FBI intake regarding a tip about a party the caller believes was hosted by Epstein on Palm Beach Island, FL, around Christmas 2000.

persons.name: Bobby Cox
persons.context: Introduced to the caller before the party; described as a young man who introduced himself as a model scout. The caller joked he was a 'pimp'.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The caller believes this person was the hostess of the Epstein party. The caller's friend went inside to speak with her.

persons.name: Curt Schmidt
persons.context: Met by the caller at the party. When approached, he asked if the caller was 'cool', which was interpreted as a reference to sex or cocaine.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Someone at the party announced that Trump had invited everyone to a party at Mar-a-Lago. The caller's friend clarified the current party was 'for prostitutes'.

connections.description: Maxwell is believed by the caller to have been the hostess at a party at a house belonging to Epstein.
Cox brought the caller to a party the caller believes was hosted by Epstein, suggesting an association with Epstein's social circle.
Schmidt was present at the party the caller believes was hosted by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Christmas Party in Palm Beach
events.description: A party around Christmas time on Palm Beach Island, FL, which the caller believes was hosted by Jeffrey Epstein. The caller was brought by Bobby Cox, met Curt Schmidt, and there was mention of an invitation to Mar-a-Lago.

events.title: FBI Tip Received
events.description: A caller contacted the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information regarding a Jeffrey Epstein party from 2000.

locations: Mar-a-Lago (implied location in Palm Beach, FL)
keyFacts: A tip was provided to the FBI in October 2020 regarding a Jeffrey Epstein party in Palm Beach around Christmas 2000.
The caller was introduced to a man named Bobby Cox, who presented himself as a model scout but was jokingly called a 'pimp'.
The caller met Curt Schmidt, CEO of Blue Buffalo, at the party, where a conversation about being 'cool' was interpreted as referencing sex or cocaine.
Someone at the party announced an invitation from Donald Trump to a party at Mar-a-Lago, but the caller's friend clarified the current gathering was 'for prostitutes'.
The document records second-hand information from a caller relaying a story from a friend ('S---'), with the last contact between them being in 2002.
